section.title: Iterator Classes
section.para: When looking at the Java API documentation you will find the Iterator andListIterator interfaces, but you will find no concrete classes implementing these interfaces. Yet you still can query concrete collections for concrete iterators and use them. So, where do they come from.

This is a good example of using inner classes. An iterator is tightly coupled to the collection through which it iterated and only the collection should create iterators. The query methods, iterator() and listIterator() return a instantiate the inner iterator classes and return a handle to the created instances.
